member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Util.CreateHelperWindow
member.summary: Creates an transparent window without dimension that can be used to temporarily obtain focus and/or be used as a window message sink.

member.returns: True if the data was successfully written.

member.summary: Checks a list of candidates for equality to a given reference value.
member.param: The evaluated value.
A liste of possible values that are regarded valid.
member.returns: True if one of the submitted matches the evaluated value. If the parameter itself is null, too, the method returns false as well, which allows to check with null values, too.

member.name: T:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.BalloonFlags
member.summary: Flags that define the icon that is shown on a balloon tooltip.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.BalloonFlags.None
member.summary: No icon is displayed.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.BalloonFlags.Info
member.summary: An information icon is displayed.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.BalloonFlags.Warning
member.summary: A warning icon is displayed.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.BalloonFlags.Error
member.summary: An error icon is displayed.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.BalloonFlags.User
member.summary: Windows XP Service Pack 2 (SP2) and later. Use a custom icon as the title icon.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.BalloonFlags.NoSound
member.summary: Windows XP (Shell32.dll version 6.0) and later. Do not play the associated sound. Applies only to balloon ToolTips.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.BalloonFlags.LargeIcon
member.summary:
Windows Vista (Shell32.dll version 6.0.6) and later. The large version of the icon should be used as the balloon icon. This corresponds to the icon with dimensions SM_CXICON x SM_CYICON. If this flag is not set, the icon with dimensions XM_CXSMICON x SM_CYSMICON is used.
- This flag can be used with all stock icons.
- Applications that use older customized icons (NIIF_USER with hIcon) must provide a new SM_CXICON x SM_CYICON version in the tray icon (hIcon). These icons are scaled down when they are displayed in the System Tray or System Control Area (SCA).
- New customized icons (NIIF_USER with hBalloonIcon) must supply an SM_CXICON x SM_CYICON version in the supplied icon (hBalloonIcon).

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.BalloonFlags.RespectQuietTime
member.summary: Windows 7 and later.

member.name: T:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.BalloonIcon
member.summary: Supported icons for the tray's balloon messages.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.BalloonIcon.None
member.summary: The balloon message is displayed without an icon.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.BalloonIcon.Info
member.summary: An information is displayed.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.BalloonIcon.Warning
member.summary: A warning is displayed.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.BalloonIcon.Error
member.summary: An error is displayed.

member.summary: Win API struct providing coordinates for a single point.

member.summary: The notify icon version that is used. The higher the version, the more capabilities are available.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconVersion.Win95
member.summary: Default behavior (legacy Win95). Expects a size of 488.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconVersion.Win2000
member.summary: Behavior representing Win2000 an higher. Expects a size of 504.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconVersion.Vista
member.summary: Extended tooltip support, which is available for Vista and later.

member.name: T:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconDataMembers
member.summary: Indicates which members of a structure were set, and thus contain valid data or provide additional information to the ToolTip as to how it should display.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconDataMembers.Message
member.summary: The message ID is set.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconDataMembers.Icon
member.summary: The notification icon is set.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconDataMembers.Tip
member.summary: The tooltip is set.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconDataMembers.State
member.summary: State information () is set. This applies to both and .

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconDataMembers.Info
member.summary: The balloon ToolTip is set. Accordingly, the following members are set: , , , and .

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconDataMembers.Realtime
member.summary:
Windows Vista (Shell32.dll version 6.0.6) and later. If the ToolTip cannot be displayed immediately, discard it.
Use this flag for ToolTips that represent real-time information which would be meaningless or misleading if displayed at a later time. For example, a message that states "Your telephone is ringing."
This modifies and must be combined with the flag.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconDataMembers.UseLegacyToolTips
member.summary:
Windows Vista (Shell32.dll version 6.0.6) and later. Use the standard ToolTip. Normally, when uVersion is set to NOTIFYICON_VERSION_4, the standard ToolTip is replaced by the application-drawn pop-up user interface (UI). If the application wants to show the standard tooltip in that case, regardless of whether the on-hover UI is showing, it can specify NIF_SHOWTIP to indicate the standard tooltip should still be shown.
Note that the NIF_SHOWTIP flag is effective until the next call to Shell_NotifyIcon.

member.name: T:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink
member.summary: Receives messages from the taskbar icon through window messages of an underlying helper window.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.CallbackMessageId
member.summary: The ID of messages that are received from the the taskbar icon.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.taskbarRestartMessageId
member.summary: The ID of the message that is being received if the taskbar is (re)started.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.isDoubleClick
member.summary: Used to track whether a mouse-up event is just the aftermath of a double-click and therefore needs to be suppressed.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.messageHandler
member.summary: A delegate that processes messages of the hidden native window that receives window messages. Storing this reference makes sure we don't loose our reference to the message window.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.#ctor(Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconVersion)
member.summary: Creates a new message sink that receives message from a given taskbar icon.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.CreateEmpty
member.summary:
Creates a dummy instance that provides an empty pointer rather than a real window handler.
Used at design time.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.CreateMessageWindow
member.summary: Creates the helper message window that is used to receive messages from the taskbar icon.

member.summary: Callback method that receives messages from the taskbar area.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.ProcessWindowMessage(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Processes incoming system messages.
member.param: Callback ID.
If the version is or higher, this parameter can be used to resolve mouse coordinates. Currently not in use.
Provides information about the event.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the object.
member.remarks: This method is not virtual by design. Derived classes should override .

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.Finalize
member.summary:
This destructor will run only if the method does not get called. This gives this base class the opportunity to finalize.
Important: Do not provide destructors in types derived from this class.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WindowMessageSink.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the windows hook that receives window messages and closes the underlying helper window.

member.summary: Window class ID.

member.summary: Main operations performed on the function.

member.summary: The taskbar icon is being created.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyCommand.Modify
member.summary: The settings of the taskbar icon are being updated.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyCommand.Delete
member.summary: The taskbar icon is deleted.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyCommand.SetFocus
member.summary: Focus is returned to the taskbar icon. Currently not in use.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyCommand.SetVersion
member.summary: Shell32.dll version 5.0 and later only. Instructs the taskbar to behave according to the version number specified in the uVersion member of the structure pointed to by lpdata. This message allows you to specify whether you want the version 5.0 behavior found on Microsoft Windows 2000 systems, or the behavior found on earlier Shell versions. The default value for uVersion is zero, indicating that the original Windows 95 notify icon behavior should be used.

member.name: T:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.TaskbarIcon
member.summary: Contains declarations of WPF dependency properties and events.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.TaskbarIcon.CreateCustomToolTip
member.summary:
Creates a control that either wraps the currently set control or the string.
If itself is already a instance, it will be used directly.
member.remarks: We use a rather than because there was no way to prevent a popup from causing cyclic open/close commands if it was placed under the mouse. ToolTip internally uses a Popup of its own, but takes advance of Popup's internal property which prevents this issue.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.TaskbarIcon.WriteToolTipSettings
member.summary: Sets tooltip settings for the class depending on defined dependency properties and OS support.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.TaskbarIcon.CreatePopup
member.summary:
Creates a control that either wraps the currently set control or the string.
If itself is already a instance, it will be used directly.
member.remarks: We use a rather than because there was no way to prevent a popup from causing cyclic open/close commands if it was placed under the mouse. ToolTip internally uses a Popup of its own, but takes advance of Popup's internal property which prevents this issue.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.TaskbarIcon.Finalize
member.summary:
This destructor will run only if the method does not get called. This gives this base class the opportunity to finalize.
Important: Do not provide destructors in types derived from this class.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.TaskbarIcon.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes the object.
member.remarks: This method is not virtual by design. Derived classes should override .

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.TaskbarIcon.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the tray and releases all resources.

Dispose(bool disposing) executes in two distinct scenarios. If disposing equals true, the method has been called directly or indirectly by a user's code. Managed and unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.param: If disposing equals false, the method has been called by the runtime from inside the finalizer and you should not reference other objects. Only unmanaged resources can be disposed.
member.remarks: Check the property to determine whether the method has already been called.

member.summary: Creates, updates or deletes the taskbar icon.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.WinApi.GetDoubleClickTime
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of milliseconds that can elapse between a first click and a second click for the OS to consider the mouse action a double-click.
member.returns: The maximum amount of time, in milliseconds, that can elapse between a first click and a second click for the OS to consider the mouse action a double-click.

member.summary: Gets the screen coordinates of the current mouse position.

member.name: T:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconState
member.summary: The state of the icon - can be set to hide the icon.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconState.Visible
member.summary: The icon is visible.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.IconState.Hidden
member.summary: Hide the icon.

member.name: T:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData
member.summary: A struct that is submitted in order to configure the taskbar icon. Provides various members that can be configured partially, according to the values of the that were defined.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.cbSize
member.summary: Size of this structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.WindowHandle
member.summary: Handle to the window that receives notification messages associated with an icon in the taskbar status area. The Shell uses hWnd and uID to identify which icon to operate on when Shell_NotifyIcon is invoked.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.TaskbarIconId
member.summary: Application-defined identifier of the taskbar icon. The Shell uses hWnd and uID to identify which icon to operate on when Shell_NotifyIcon is invoked. You can have multiple icons associated with a single hWnd by assigning each a different uID. This feature, however is currently not used.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.ValidMembers
member.summary: Flags that indicate which of the other members contain valid data. This member can be a combination of the NIF_XXX constants.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.CallbackMessageId
member.summary: Application-defined message identifier. The system uses this identifier to send notifications to the window identified in hWnd.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.IconHandle
member.summary: A handle to the icon that should be displayed. Just .

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.ToolTipText
member.summary: String with the text for a standard ToolTip. It can have a maximum of 64 characters including the terminating NULL. For Version 5.0 and later, szTip can have a maximum of 128 characters, including the terminating NULL.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.IconState
member.summary: State of the icon. Remember to also set the .

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.StateMask
member.summary: A value that specifies which bits of the state member are retrieved or modified. For example, setting this member to causes only the item's hidden state to be retrieved.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.BalloonText
member.summary: String with the text for a balloon ToolTip. It can have a maximum of 255 characters. To remove the ToolTip, set the NIF_INFO flag in uFlags and set szInfo to an empty string.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.VersionOrTimeout
member.summary: Mainly used to set the version when is invoked with . However, for legacy operations, the same member is also used to set timouts for balloon ToolTips.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.BalloonTitle
member.summary: String containing a title for a balloon ToolTip. This title appears in boldface above the text. It can have a maximum of 63 characters.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.BalloonFlags
member.summary: Adds an icon to a balloon ToolTip, which is placed to the left of the title. If the member is zero-length, the icon is not shown.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.TaskbarIconGuid
member.summary:
Windows XP (Shell32.dll version 6.0) and later.
- Windows 7 and later: A registered GUID that identifies the icon. This value overrides uID and is the recommended method of identifying the icon.
- Windows XP through Windows Vista: Reserved.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.CustomBalloonIconHandle
member.summary:
Windows Vista (Shell32.dll version 6.0.6) and later. The handle of a customized balloon icon provided by the application that should be used independently of the tray icon. If this member is non-NULL and the flag is set, this icon is used as the balloon icon.
If this member is NULL, the legacy behavior is carried out.

member.name: M:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.Interop.NotifyIconData.CreateDefault(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Creates a default data structure that provides a hidden taskbar icon without the icon being set.

member.name: T:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.PopupActivationMode
member.summary: Defines flags that define when a popup is being displyed.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.PopupActivationMode.LeftClick
member.summary: The item is displayed if the user clicks the tray icon with the left mouse button.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.PopupActivationMode.RightClick
member.summary: The item is displayed if the user clicks the tray icon with the right mouse button.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.PopupActivationMode.DoubleClick
member.summary: The item is displayed if the user double-clicks the tray icon.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.PopupActivationMode.LeftOrRightClick
member.summary: The item is displayed if the user clicks the tray icon with the left or the right mouse button.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.PopupActivationMode.LeftOrDoubleClick
member.summary: The item is displayed if the user clicks the tray icon with the left mouse button or if a double-click is being performed.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.PopupActivationMode.MiddleClick
member.summary: The item is displayed if the user clicks the tray icon with the middle mouse button.

member.name: F:Hardcodet.Wpf.TaskbarNotification.PopupActivationMode.All
member.summary: The item is displayed whenever a click occurs.

Event that will be handled
Event handler to be added

member.param: UIElement or ContentElement that listens to the event
Event that will no longer be handled
Event handler to be removed

member.summary: Resolves the current tray position.
